docs.snippet: When Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg was launching a social media revolution 12 years ago, one of his suitemates at Harvard University was pursuing a different status: becoming a rabbi in Israel.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Roommate of Facebook Founder Becomes Rabbi in Israel
headline.main: Ex-Roommate of Facebook Founder Becomes Rabbi in Israel

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc launched a workplace version of its mobile app and website on Monday, marking the social networking company's first foray into the hotly competitive and crowded enterprise software arena.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Rolls Out Business Software, Launches Pricing War
headline.main: Facebook Rolls Out Business Software, Launches Pricing War

docs.snippet: Three men are badly injured as video streams the gunfire and the aftermath in Norfolk, Va.

headline.main: Another Night, Another Shooting on Facebook Live

docs.snippet: The social media giant courted new- and old-media companies to create material for its news feed. And then it decided to put news in the back seat.

headline.main: Feeling Stung by a Fickle Friend Named Facebook

docs.snippet: Readers discuss how social media influences and reflects what we think.
Police in the tiny town of Cherryvale, Kansas, looking to track down the owner of an abandoned gram of crystal meth have taken their case to social media.

headline.print_headline: Police in Kansas Town Use Facebook in Hunt for Owner of Meth
headline.main: Police in Kansas Town Use Facebook in Hunt for Owner of Meth

docs.snippet: A Cambodian opposition MP was jailed for two and a half years on Monday for posting a map on Facebook professing to show that the government had ceded territory to Vietnam.

headline.print_headline: Cambodian Opposition MP Jailed Over 'Fake' Facebook Border Map
headline.main: Cambodian Opposition MP Jailed Over 'Fake' Facebook Border Map

docs.snippet: Facebook said its main UK subsidiary generated an 11-million-pound tax credit in 2015 even as revenues soared, thanks to its tax efficient structure, accounts published on the weekend showed.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Reports 11-Million-Pound UK Tax Credit as Revenues Soar
headline.main: Facebook Reports 11-Million-Pound UK Tax Credit as Revenues Soar

docs.snippet: U.S. police departments used location data and other user information from Twitter, Facebook and Instagram to track protesters in Ferguson, Missouri, and Baltimore, according to a report from the American Civil Liberties Union on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Police Used Facebook, Twitter Data to Track Protesters-ACLU
headline.main: U.S. Police Used Facebook, Twitter Data to Track Protesters-ACLU

docs.snippet: The social media company responded to Congressional questions about how its Trending Topics feed is managed, but some users are still wondering why the feature isn’t very useful.
